text: Hieronyma is a genus in the plant family Phyllanthaceae. It was first described as a genus in 1848.Tropicos, Hieronyma Allemão Allemão e Cysneiro, Francisco Freire. 1848. Hieronima alchorneoides (Typographis do Archivo medico brasileiro). This family was formerly united with spurges, crotons, copperleaves, etc. (Euphorbiaceae), but have turned out to be well distinct. The genus is native to South America, Central America, southern Mexico, and the West Indies.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant Families The spelling Hieronyma has been conserved; the spellings Hieronima and Hyeronima are spelling variants of this name. Hieronyma is used locally as a foodplant, e.g. by the Nukak of Guaviare Department in the Amazon natural region of Colombia. Several species are threatened by deforestation. ;Species ==References== Category:Phyllanthaceae genera
title: Hieronyma
